meanings.definition: To provide with a key or keys.
meanings.sent1: She keyed the lock to keep her belongings safe.
meanings.sent2: He keyed the car before handing the keys to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The magician keyed the treasure chest to only open with a special spell.
meanings.sent4: The detective keyed the safe combination to unlock the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith keyed the door with a unique design to stand out.

meanings.definition: To regulate or adjust with a key or keys.
meanings.sent1: He keyed the piano to make sure it was in tune for the concert.
meanings.sent2: She keyed the thermostat to keep the room at a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic keyed the engine to run smoothly like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: The gardener keyed the irrigation system to water the plants at the right time.
meanings.sent5: The technician keyed the settings to optimize the performance of the device.

meanings.definition: To enter (data) by means of a keyboard.
meanings.sent1: She keyed in the password to access her computer.
meanings.sent2: He keyed the information into the database for future reference.
meanings.sent3: The student keyed the essay into the word processor to submit online.
meanings.sent4: The receptionist keyed the appointments into the scheduling system.
meanings.sent5: The cashier keyed the prices into the register for accurate billing.
